intro: Pseudanthistiria, commonly known as the false spurge. It is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its unique floral structures. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. They are native to various regions in Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Some species of Pseudanthistiria are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
